taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

taxonConcepts.scientificName: Channa micropeltes (Cuvier in Cuvier and Valenciennes, 1831)
Channa micropeltes (Cuvier in Cuvier and Valenciennes, 1831)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Occurs in lowland river and swamp (Ref. 57235).  Usually associated with deep water bodies (Ref. 27732).  Found in large streams and canals (Ref. 4833), with standing or slowly flowing water (Ref. 12693).  Feeds mainly on fish but also takes some crustaceans.  Spawns in small streams with dense vegetation (Ref. 56749).  Utilized as a food fish (Ref. 4931).  Economic important mainly from capture fisheries (Ref. 57235).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Asia:  Mekong and Chao Phraya basins; the Malay Peninsula, and the islands of Sumatra and Borneo.  Material from India usually referred to as this species actually represents a distinct species.
dataObjects.references: Kottelat, M. 1998 Fishes of the Nam Theun and Xe Bangfai basins, Laos, with diagnoses of twenty-two new species (Teleostei: Cyprinidae, Balitoridae, Cobitidae, Coiidae and Odontobutidae). Ichthyol. Explor. Freshwat. 9(1):1-128. (Ref. 27732)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.description: 130 cm SL (male/unsexed; (Ref. 30857)); max. published weight: 20.0 kg (Ref. 4835)
references: Baird, I.G., V. Inthaphaisy, P. Kisouvannalath, B. Phylavanh and B. Mounsouphom 1999 The fishes of southern Lao. Lao Community Fisheries and Dolphin Protection Project. Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry, Lao PDR.161 p. (Ref. 30857)
Mohsin, A.K.M. and M.A. Ambak 1983 Freshwater fishes of Peninsular Malaysia. Penerbit Universiti Pertanian Malaysia, Malaysia. 284 p. (Ref. 4835)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: A broad, dark longitudinal stripe in adults; two black longitudinal stripes with a bright orange intermediate area in juveniles (Ref. 27732).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Environment
dataObjects.description: benthopelagic; potamodromous (Ref. 51243); freshwater; depth range 100 - ? m (Ref. 27732)
references: Riede, K. 2004 Global register of migratory species - from global to regional scales. Final Report of the R&D-Projekt 808 05 081. Federal Agency for Nature Conservation, Bonn, Germany. 329 p. (Ref. 51243)

Kottelat, M. 1998 Fishes of the Nam Theun and Xe Bangfai basins, Laos, with diagnoses of twenty-two new species (Teleostei: Cyprinidae, Balitoridae, Cobitidae, Coiidae and Odontobutidae). Ichthyol. Explor. Freshwat. 9(1):1-128. (Ref. 27732)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Migration
dataObjects.description: Potamodromous. Migrating within streams, migratory in rivers, e.g. Saliminus, Moxostoma, Labeo.  Migrations should be cyclical and predictable and cover more than 100 km.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Uses
dataObjects.title: Importance
dataObjects.description: fisheries: commercial; aquaculture: commercial; gamefish: yes; aquarium: public aquariums
